title: Job Vacancies at Maybrands Limited
content:
Maybrands is the No.1 Retailer of FOSSIL products in Nigeria. We are the only licensed store to sell fossil products in Nigeria, these Include;Fossil,Skagen, Emporio Armani, Diesel, Michael Kors, DKNY, Armani Exchange, Chaps, Nixon. You can find all your fashion accessories for both women and men.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

1.) Internal Control Executive

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive Internal Control Executive to join our team.
	The ideal candidate will have practical experience in internal control processes, with a ability to identify risks, support control measures, and ensure operational compliance. You should have intermediate analytical skills, excellent time management, and reporting abilities. Retail industry experience will be a plus.


Key Responsibilities


	Assist in the implementation and continuous improvement of internal control policies and procedures across business operations.
	Conduct regular internal control checks, audits, and reviews to ensure compliance with company policies and regulatory requirements.
	Identify areas of process improvement and recommend corrective actions to strengthen internal control systems.
	Monitor daily operational activities and ensure proper documentation and adherence to internal control standards.
	Prepare periodic reports and presentations on internal control findings for management review.
	Perform data analysis using Excel to identify trends, discrepancies, and potential risks.
	Support investigations into operational breaches, discrepancies, or fraudulent activities.
	Collaborate with various departments to ensure smooth implementation of internal control measures.
	Participate in risk assessments and assist in the design of control measures for new processes.
	Track corrective action plans and ensure timely closure of internal control gaps.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	1-3 years of relevant work experience in internal control, audit, or compliance roles.
	Intermediate analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and identify risk patterns.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel.
	Excellent time management skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and meet deadlines.
	High level of accuracy and attention to detail.
	Good reporting and documentation skills.
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment.
	Retail industry experience is an added advantage.


Preferred Skills:


	Experience with ERP systems (e.g., Odoo) is a plus.
	Familiarity with audit or control tools is an added benefit.


Click here to apply online

 

 

2.) Sales Associate and Sales Trainee (Retail Luxury & Fashion Brand)

Job Locations: Lekki, Victoria Island and Ikoyi - Lagos and Port Harcourt - Rivers
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Liaise with clients in all areas of sales including but not limited to product information, information on special discounts, new products, company services etc.
	Provide effective, efficient and prompt service delivery to customers
	Offer advice to customers on products in line with customer needs
	Deal with customers complaints and ensure complete resolution on every complaint
	Monitor stock in display cabinets and replenish products as required
	Constantly clean display cabinets and ensure spotless at all times
	Merchandise products in an appealing manner in line with brand Visual Merchandising guidelines
	Process payments and customer receipts
	Manage assigned stock on the shop floor and ensure accountability.


Qualifications


	First Degree or equivalent education
	Minimum 1 - 2 years of post NYSC work experience
	Good team player
	Good oral and written communication skills
	Good interpersonal skills
	Neat, clean, friendly
	Willingness to learn
	Adaptability and flexibility
	Willing to take on additional responsibility
	Comfortable with Information Technology, proficient in MS Word & Excel.


Click here to apply online

 

 

3.) Business Manager / Team Lead, Sales

Job Locations: Ikoyi & Lekki - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	As the Business Manager, you get to act as one of our Retail Store Managers, you will be responsible for overseeing employees and finances, and also controlling the quality of products and services offered to customers.


Key Responsibilities


	Achieve the store's monthly/annual sales target.
	Achieve margin for high-grossing products.
	Administration of Store, 3rd party businesses, etc.
	Ensure the ambiance of the store is very lively and conducive, good music, clean, engaging, orderly, etc.
	Ensure zero stock out, right ordering, varieties, good inventory management-First In-First Out, etc.
	Ensure customer complaints are reduced to the barest minimum.
	Achieve the VD targets for brands and products.
	Oversee the store's operational cost such as Diesel, Power, Overheads, Production, etc.
	Ensure preventable loss is minimal, and losses are accounted for accurately.
	Ensure reports are timely & accurate.


Key Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business administration, finance management, or a related field from a recognized University.
	3+ years of experience as a store manager or any supervisory role.
	Proven experience with preparing budgets, and financial and expense reports.
	Knowledge of product and consumer trends, marketing strategies, and how to utilize them.
	Strong supervisory, interpersonal, and collaborative skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Punctuality & and attendance, Demonstrate improvement efforts.
	Keen attention to detail.
	Must be analytical and comfortable reviewing data.
	Proficiency in Excel is required.
	Must be motivated, organized, and determined.
	Proven ability to build collaborative relationships across cross-functional teams.
	Must be results-driven, commercially aware, and have problem-solving abilities.
	Must be able to juggle multiple tasks, work with a plan, and work in a fast-paced environment

Assistant QHSE Manager Job at Adexen Recruitment Agency




        
    

        
        Adexen Recruitment Agency - Our client, a leading maritime organization, is recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant QHSE Manager

Job Location: Onne, Rivers
Job Type: Full time

Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To lead HSE team in ensuring continual improvement of operational safety management knowledge and application.
	The mission is to support the vessels and Client Satisfaction Chain management in achieving and maintaining sustainable high levels of compliance with Group HSE expectations, based on and aligned with Group HSE Plan requirements.
	To deliver and report on HSE expectations 
	To ensure all incidents are adequately investigated, root causes identified and corrective actions managed for continual improvement
	Ensure OVMSA is updated regularly with good client score
	Follow up with Vessel OVID inspection results for close out with Vessels
	Develope and deploy Yearly QHSE Plan and manage its implementation across the Marine Fleets and onshore
	Manage the accurate and timely reporting of statistics pertaining to HSE.
	Analyse HSE statistics to identify trends and develop Action Plans to minimize incident rates and improve HSE performance.
	Yearly review of the Safety Management System in line with international standard requirements
	Lead HSE campaigns within the organization both on the vessel and onshore
	Ensure adequate plans for emergency preparedness are made within the organization by planning, training and following up.


Desired Skills and Experience


	Bachelors degree or equivalent from a reputable institution
	Minimum of 5 years of work experience within the Oil and Gas industry out of which 2years must be in same function within or outside the organisation.

We are clear-cut and determined to set a global standard in the tourism and hospitality sector as we provide all-around excellence and peerless satisfaction in service delivery to our guests.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Operations Manager

Job Location: Ado - Ikare Rd, Ado Ekiti, Ekiti

Job Description

Job Summary


	Ikogosi Warm Springs and Resort is seeking an experienced Operations Manager to oversee the daily operations, ensure top-tier guest experience, and maintain the resort’s high service standards.
	The ideal candidate will be responsible for managing staff, optimizing operational efficiency, and enhancing the overall profitability of the resort.


Key Responsibilities
Resort Operations Management:


	Oversee day-to-day resort activities, including lodging, food and beverage, recreation, and maintenance.
	 Ensure smooth functioning of all departments, including front desk, housekeeping, kitchen, and guest services.
	Develop and implement standard operating procedures (SOPs) to improve efficiency.

	Monitor and improve guest satisfaction through feedback and service enhancements.
	 Coordinate special events, excursions, and experiences to enhance guest stays.

Marketing Manager Job at Invealth Partners Limited




        
    

        
        Invealth Partners Limited is an Investment and Management company with a focus on creating investment opportunities and strategic partnerships in the African continent. The company is poised to create efficiency and viability in the Infrastructure, healthcare, energy, retail and commodity sector while attracting investment and management of this portfolio to ensure sustainable growth and directly impact on service delivery across targeted ecosystems.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Marketing Manager

Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers 
Job Type Full time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Hospital Marketer will be responsible for developing and implementing marketing strategies to promote the hospital’s services and enhance its brand visibility.
	This role involves building and maintaining relationships with referring physicians, corporate organizations, and the community to increase patient inflow.
	The Hospital Marketer will collaborate with clinical and administrative teams to design campaigns, organize outreach programs, and analyze market trends to ensure the hospital remains competitive.
	The ideal candidate will be proactive, creative, and possess strong networking skills.


Main Duties


	Develop and execute comprehensive marketing plans to promote hospital services.
	Identify and target and market facility’s services to potential referral sources such as clinics, physicians, and corporate organizations.
	Organize and participate in health fairs, community outreach programs, and hospital open days.
	Design and distribute marketing materials, including brochures, newsletters, and digital content.
	Manage the hospital’s social media presence and online reputation.
	Conduct market research to identify new opportunities and trends in healthcare services.
	Build and maintain relationships with key stakeholders, including doctors, corporate clients, and insurance companies.
	Track and analyze the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and prepare regular reports.
	Collaborate with clinical teams to highlight new services, technologies, and specialties.
	Coordinate with external vendors for advertising, printing, and event management.
	Monitor competitors’ activities and recommend strategies for differentiation.
	Develop and maintain a CRM database of clients, partners, and referral sources.
	Organize seminars, workshops, and continuing medical education (CME) events.
	Handle inquiries from prospective patients and facilitate their onboarding process.
	Prepare and manage the marketing budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness.
	Train hospital staff on customer service and patient experience best practices.
	Liaise with the media for press releases and hospital news coverage.
	Ensure compliance with healthcare advertising regulations and ethical standards.
	Gather and analyze patient feedback to improve service delivery.
	Represent the hospital at industry conferences and networking events.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years in healthcare marketing, real estate marketing, sales in the banking sector or a similar role.
	Excellent communication, marketing, negotiation, and presentation skills; proficiency in digital marketing tools and CRM software.
	Expertise in healthcare marketing policies.
